body_html:
The device options are interpreted somewhat differently in the distributed version of TensorFlow, because they are properties of the tf.train.Server, rather than an individual tf.Session. If you pass the same sess_config object as the optional config arg to the tf.train.Server constructor, you should get the desired behavior.

I'll close this issue for now, but feel free to reopen if it doesn't solve the problem.

body:
The device options are interpreted somewhat differently in the distributed version of TensorFlow, because they are properties of the [`tf.train.Server`](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/train/Server), rather than an individual `tf.Session`. If you pass the same `sess_config` object as the optional `config` arg to the `tf.train.Server` constructor, you should get the desired behavior.

I'll close this issue for now, but feel free to reopen if it doesn't solve the problem.
